CatDescriptText: Mr. Luther V. Smith, manager of the maintenance department of the Business Training College, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe churches of any denomination receive appreciation financial help from racketeers?" answer reads: "In our Church of God, located in East Liberty, we don't receive any money from racketeers.  In fact, if any member of the church is found to be a racketeer, he is immediately put out."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Luther V. Smith, wearing moustache, light colored long sleeved shirt, and dark belt, holding paper bag under left arm, standing with hands in pockets in front of store with door, man in window, and neon sign that reads "Schmidts" on right
